courseName: Agroforestry and Food Security by Distance Learning - MSc/PgCert/PgDip
facultyName: College of Environmental Sciences and Engineering
description: The Agroforestry and Food Security MSc will provide students with a detailed understanding of the principles and processes of agroforestry as part of a sustainable food production system, including its social and environmental contexts. It will equip students to implement the latest research into sustainable production systems thinking and will facilitate entry into agroforestry-related careers.On thisÂ course you will:
duration: MSc: 1 year full time, 2-5 years part time, PGCert: 1 year part time, PGDip: 2 years part time
fees: FeesPlease see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
